page.title: 11WETHERBY POPULATION CHANGES
page.content: Although there have been some decades of population decrease{(1801-11, 1861- {71, 1881-91, 1911-21 and 1951-61)}the town of Wetherby has seen a vast growth in its population from 1144 in 1801 to 9725 in 1981. Most of this growth has taken place in recent years. The population increased by over 75% between 1961-71{(4179}to {7332)}and by over 32% between 1971-81 to reach{9725. The enormous recent increase is due to Wetherby becoming a{commuter town for Leeds, Harrogate and York. Large numbers of people have moved into new private housing developments (built by firms such as{Barratt, Comben and {Ideal)}in the north and west. Concern has been expressed at the loss of agricultural land to such developments and this is clearly shown by the present debate over{Hill Top Farm.
